# Deploying A Solidity Contract Without Truffle

  1. Start a Node session in the console and import web3 with

    â€‹

Web3 = require('web3');
  1. Next instantiate a new Web3 instance and pass in your local ganach instance as your http provider whith;
	we3 = new Web3(new Web3.providers.HttpProvider('http://localhost:7545"))

  1. At this point typing * web3.eth.accounts * should yield your 10 ganache ethereum accounts.

  2. Next we need to load our solidity compiler solc with solc = require('solc')

  3. Now we load the source code of our contract and save it to a variable called * sourceCode * by typing:

	sourceCode = fs.readFileSync('greetings.sol').toString()
  1. Now that we have loaded our source code we can compile it with our solidity compiler and save it as variable compiledCode.
	compiledCode = solc.compile(sourceCode)
  1. In order to deploy our newly compiled contract we need to first extract the contract ABI from the contract interface:
	contractABI = JSON.parse(compiledCode.contracts[':Greetings'].interface)
  1. To deploy our contract we need to create a contract factory called greetingsContract and pass it our contractABI code with:
	greetingsContract = web3.eth.contract(contractABI)
  1. We also need to extract the bytcode from our previously compiled code with:
	byteCode = compiledCode.contracts[':Greetings'].bytecode
  1. Now we an deploy our contact we need to send some our bytcode data to our greetingsContract facctory with the following:
	greetingsDeployed = greetingsContract.new({data:byteCode, from: web3.eth.accounts[0], gas: 4700000})
  1. Finally and in order to interact with our contract we need to create an instance of it by typing;
	greetingsInstance = greetingsContract.at(greetingsDeployed.address)
